qas.question: Why was Arsenal's match on 22 Jan. 1927 at Highbury a first?
What team did Arsenal play at the time of the radio broadcast in 1927?
When was Arsenal's match the first to be televised live?
To what first broadcast did Arsenal provide match highlights?
In what form was Arsenal's broadcast of a 2010 match against Manchester United?
In what stadium was Arsenal playing in for the first televised game?
On what tv channel was the 16 September 1937 Arsenal exhibition game shown?
Who won the match between Arsenal and Liverpool on 22 August 1964?
Who won the match between Arsenal and Sheffield United on 22 January 1927?
In what year did BskyB televise their first Arsenal game?

context: Arsenal have appeared in a number of media "firsts". On 22 January 1927, their match at <b5_0>Highbury<b5_0/> against <a1_0><b8_0>Sheffield United<b8_0/><a1_0/> was the first English League match to be <a0_0>broadcast live on radio<a0_0/>. A decade later, on <a2_0>16 September 1937<a2_0/>, an exhibition match between Arsenal's first team and the reserves was the first football match in the world to be televised live. Arsenal also featured in the first edition of the <a3_0><b6_0>BBC<b6_0/>'s Match of the Day<a3_0/>, which screened highlights of their match against <b7_0>Liverpool<b7_0/> at Anfield on 22 August <b9_0>1964<b9_0/>. BSkyB's coverage of Arsenal's January 2010 match against Manchester United was the first live public broadcast of a sports event on <a4_0>3D television<a4_0/>.
